title: Robert Whittaker not surprised Kelvin Gastelum dogged his last performance: 'Our paths will cross'
text:
When Robert Whittaker lost his UFC middleweight championship to Israel Adesanya, Kelvin Gastelum had quite a bit to say.

Gastelum mocked Whittaker’s second-round knockout loss to Adesanya at UFC 243, saying how he was disappointed, and that Gastelum would have dropped Whittaker like a sack of potatoes if they had fought.

The two were meant to face off for the 185-pound title at UFC 234, before an emergency hernia surgery forced Whittaker out just hours before the fight. Gastelum ended up facing Adesanya two months later at UFC 236 for the interim title, but fell just short in a classic battle.

Adesanya was then able to unify the middleweight title in a near-flawless performance over Whittaker, and Gastelum, who took Adesanya to the brink, couldn’t help but criticize Whittaker’s performance.

And Whittaker is not the least bit surprised.

“Nah, I’m not surprised,” Whittaker said in an interview with Submission Radio. “The game and the culture around it, is everyone just wants to (expletive) on each other. And yeah, it’s sad. It’s sad that people have to try and (expletive) on each other to move up in the world. Like, I think I’ve shown, you don’t have to do that. But maybe he would have. We’ll see. We’re still quite young, both me and him, and I’m sure our paths will cross.”

Gastelum is scheduled to take on Darren Till in the co-main event of UFC 244, in a fight where Whittaker could likely face the winner.

So he’ll definitely be keeping an eye out on Nov. 2, and despite the recent comments, is giving the edge to Gastelum.

“Yeah, certainly I’m gonna be watching it closely, cause they’re very likely opponents in the future,” Whittaker said. “But I would have to say, I would have to lean towards Gastelum, because I think he’s a super underrated fighter in the middleweight division. But he’s very sneaky in his approach to closing the distance and his approach in landing the strikes. He’s quite quick. We’ll have to see how Till makes the transition to middleweight. That’s always a big question mark for me, watching guys jump up. So, I’ll have to lean towards Gastelum at this point.”
description: Robert Whittaker is not surprised with Kelvin Gastelum criticizing his last performance vs. Israel Adesanya.
